entry.title: an abandoned seminary (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that an abandoned seminary (pictured) collapsed during the 2008 Sichuan earthquake, upon its 100th year of completion?

entry.title: Sally Buchanan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a pregnant Sally Buchanan was said to have carried bullets in her apron and distributed whiskey while singing during the Battle of Buchanan's Station?

entry.title: casum sentit dominus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Latin legal maxims like casum sentit dominus have been described as "guardians of eternity [...] more lasting than codifications"?

entry.title: Fort Phantom Hill (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the ruined Fort Phantom Hill was briefly a town that was the seat of Jones County, Texas?

entry.title: Johanna Geisler (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Erich Korngold's Die tote Stadt had simultaneous premieres in Cologne and Hamburg in 1920, one with Johanna Geisler and her husband Otto Klemperer?

entry.title: Get Up and Dance (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a filing for a temporary restraining order to stop the release of Get Up and Dance in the United States by the publisher of the Just Dance series was denied?

entry.title: Tiakur (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Indonesian town of Tiakur experienced a shortage of specialist doctors due to them not renewing their contract?

entry.title: Kemah Bob (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that comedian Kemah Bob maintains a drag king persona, Lil' Test Ease?
